text:
What you need to know before getting a Scottish fold cat
03 Nov 2019, 17:00 by Irina Sakharova
All about the nature, nutrition, proper care and conditions of detention.
general information

Breed name: Scottish fold cat (Scottish fold).
Country of Origin: Scotland / United Kingdom.
Weight: 4-5 kg.
Height at withers: up to 30 cm.
Life expectancy: up to 15 years.
Average price: 5‚Äì20 thousand rubles.

What does a Scottish fold cat look like?
Representatives of this breed have a squat body with well-developed muscles. Paws are powerful and not too long. The neck is short, the head is rather large and rounded, with a strong chin and round pads of whiskers. The tail is usually medium or long, pointed to the end.


Scottish folds have a very impressive appearance / phz8.petinsurance.com

The Scots coat is short, straight, thick and soft. Different colors - solid (for example, cream, white, black, blue), two-tone, tabby, tortie, smoky and others.
A characteristic feature of Scottish folds is small ears pressed to the head, which are bent forward and slightly hanging down. This difference is caused by a gene mutation, as a result of which the cartilage, including the ear, becomes softer.
Give your pet a present üè†

What is the character of a Scottish fold cat
Scottish folds are characterized by a kind, calm and balanced character. Their lifestyle is fairly measured, hyperactivity is usually not characteristic of them. You are unlikely to be constantly forced to make such a pet while trying to climb onto the closet and through the curtains or simply briskly rushing about the rooms. But this does not mean that Scottish fold cats are completely passive and behave like plush toys. By nature, they are quite curious and enthusiastically explore everything that surrounds them.


Scottish fold cats are calm and balanced. VGatto / Depositphotos.com

How Scottish fold cats get along with adults
Representatives of this breed are very loyal and sincerely attached to people. It is believed that they choose one object of adoration, but this is far from always the case. Many Scots are equally warm to all family members and distinguish someone especially only in their mood.
Scottish folds willingly show their emotions, like to communicate with the help of meow and purr. Demonstrating affection, they can literally on the heels of walking for a person throughout the apartment. And in attempts to grab attention, they often show perseverance and self-will.
Most Scottish fold cats are not very fond of being squeezed and picked up. Although the mood may well purr on his knees. Against stroking and other caresses usually do not mind.
How Scottish fold cats get along with children
In dealing with children, purrs are patient and calm. Aggression is rare, and in order to provoke it, you need to try very hard. Too funny and noisy games are not always to their liking, so cats try to avoid such activities and sit back.
How Scottish fold cats get along with other pets


Scots get along well with dogs. ViktoriaSapata / Depositphotos.com

Scottish folds coexist quite comfortably with dogs and other cats. At the same time, they emphasize neutrality and do not try to impose their superiority in an aggressive form. But to make friends with a hamster or a parrot they can prevent hunting instinct.
Remember üêØ


What to do if a cat is aggressive


What conditions are required for Scottish fold cats
Representatives of this breed will be quite comfortable within the walls of an ordinary apartment. The main thing is to give them their own secluded place where the cat can spend time alone with himself. At the same time, the bed should be located away from drafts that are dangerous for Scottish folds.


Protect your pet from drafts / Royal-canin.ru

For the safety of the animal, it is advisable to install special protective nets on the windows. If they are not there, the cat may fall out of the window when trying to catch a bird or a falling leaf.
It is worth taking care of cat's leisure. In addition to a berth and a tray, the Scotsman definitely needs a scratching post. With it, he will be able to put his paws in order and will not encroach on your furniture.


Diversify your pet's leisure activities. belchonock / Depositphotos.com

To diversify the life of a Scottish fold cat, balls, mice and other toys will help. You can also install a whole game center, which will also provide additional physical activity for cats and support their physical shape.
Scots can be called domestic cats. Although if the cat feels calm and comfortable in the fresh air, take it on short promenades or let it out in your own garden. At the same time, walking Scottish folds cannot be left unattended for a long time.
Help the pet üï∑Ô∏è

How to Feed Scottish Fold Ears
The easiest way to stay at the finished wet and dry feed. It is better to choose from the lines of proven brands, because only high-quality full-feed feeds provide the animal with all the necessary proteins, fats, carbohydrates, trace elements and vitamins. In addition, you can sometimes give useful goodies that not only help to diversify the menu, but also, for example, help to clean the teeth of the animal.
Choose a ready-made diet taking into account the characteristics of the animal - age, state of health and the presence of chronic diseases, sterilization, pregnancy and lactation.
Another option is natural products, such as meat and offal, cereals. But ordinary food from the human table is forbidden for the Scots. It simply does not provide the cats with everything they need, and sometimes it can even be a danger to their life.


Food from our table is not suitable for cats. belchonock / Depositphotos.com

When deciding how to feed Scottish fold, consider what kind of food he was used to while he was living with the breeder. A sharp change will not benefit the animal, moreover, a kitten can simply refuse unusual food. Even if you decide to change the diet, you need to do this gradually.
Representatives of this breed are often prone to obesity. This must be taken into account when drawing up the diet. Do not overfeed your pet, as obesity can lead to a number of health problems.

How to care for a Scottish fold cat
The thick coat of these animals needs constant and thorough care. Fur seals need at least a couple of times a week. In the periods of spring and autumn, it is advisable to do this every day.
Another important point is ear care. Due to the unusual structure, a lot of sulfur accumulates in the auricles. You can remove it with cotton swabs and special lotions, which are sold in pet stores. This procedure should be performed on average once a week or two.


Do not forget to regularly cut the claws of the pet. Syda_Productions / Depositphotos.com

Also, Scottish folds need to be clipped regularly, about once a month.
As for bathing, it is enough for pets only to arrange a bathing day every six months or even less, and for lovers to walk - every couple of months.
Be surprised ü¶Å

How are Scottish fold cats sick?
Scottish folds are reasonably healthy. However, there are several diseases that are genetically specific to this breed.

Osteochondrodysplasia (OCD) is a malformation of cartilage and bone tissue, which leads to a slowdown in their growth. This disease is considered incurable, so that only maintenance therapy is prescribed for it.
Polycystic kidney disease (PKP) is a disease in which many hollow tumors with fluid contents (cysts) form in the kidneys. As a result, the affected organs do not fully fulfill their function.
Cardiomyopathy is a disease in which the normal functioning of the heart muscle is disturbed.

Also, Scottish fold cats can also suffer from diseases characteristic of most purring pets. Among them are problems with the genitourinary system, skin and other diseases.

What to look for when buying a Scottish fold cat
You can buy Scottish fold through classified sites, at an exhibition, or in a certified nursery.
The price of a kitten depends on many factors, including the region (in the capital, the cost is often higher), the pedigree. Significantly affects the class of the animal. So, ‚Äúpet‚Äù is a cat for the soul, which does not shine exhibition career or participation in breeding. The price of such animals is lower, while they are usually sterilized. The next class is the brid. These cats are potential producers from whom you can expect worthy offspring. And finally, the most expensive class is the ‚Äúshow‚Äù. These animals have every chance to compete for prizes at exhibitions. Moreover, such a high status should be confirmed not just by words, but by exhibition certificates.
Another important point is the health of the future pet. Therefore, when choosing, it is worthwhile to carefully examine the kitten. Severe thinness, bald patches, fleas, too bloated abdomen may indicate improper care and dishonesty of the breeder. In addition, some behaviors of Scottish folds may be signs of a genetic disease that affects bone and cartilage. So, if the legs and tail are inactive, and the kitten itself cannot run and jump normally, it is better to refrain from buying.


Be sure to find out about the kitten's parents. tankist276 / Depositphotos.com

Pay attention to parents. One of them, and possibly both, should be erect (Scottish Straight). If both the cat and the cat have hanging ears, their offspring are almost guaranteed to be unhealthy.
As for the documents, upon purchase you must be given a contract of sale, a veterinary passport with vaccination marks and a metric. Based on the last pedigree, you can arrange yourself.
